page.title: 04MISS BENTALL REMEMBERS
page.content: Miss Bentall came to visit us. Her family has lived in Barling for 94 years.Miss Bentall works in her orchard she sells quite a lot of plums, apples, raspberries, gooseberries and blackcurrants a year.Miss Bentall's house is 300 years old. It is called Bolts Farm and she has lived there for all her life. Miss Bentall remembered that when she was a child the village was very pretty and that the people went about on horses, bikes and there were only a couple of cars.Miss Bentall said Barling was still very pretty. She said she does not like the tip and everyone says the same. Behind Miss Bentall's house there is the River Roach. Miss Bentall can remember when sailing barges used to come to the old quay at the end of her lane to load wheat for the mill at Stambridge.
